content.description: Start at the base of the finger crack under the large roof. When the crack ends, move left (crux) and then up through a series of roofs and corners protected by bolts.
content.protection: Single rack with mostly finger-sized pieces. A 4.5 inch cam can be placed where the crack briefly widens but it's not necessary.
content.location: Locate the obvious large roof. EasilyÂ seen from the parking lot.

content.description: Start up the slab toward the high first bolt. Crux come up high with slab moves on grainy patina.
content.location: To the right of Unnamed sources, shares the same (upper) anchors

content.description:
Climb up a short ramp to a small ledge with a one bolt belay anchor. Continue past another ramp to the base of a dihedral protected by bolts. Climb the dihedral (crux) and belay at a pair of bolted anchors.

It is helpful to bring your belayer up to the one bolt anchor before continuing on as the angle of both ramps is quite low and a fall from the dihedral, combined with rope stretch, can cause the leader to hit the ramp.
content.protection:
Mostly bolt protected with chains at the top. A few cams are useful to supplement protection between bolts.

Rappel with two ropes. If you have a 70m rope, you can rappel to the one-bolt belay and escape left, then scramble down on easy rock. A 60m will not reach.
content.location: This is the left-most climb on Parking Lot wall.

content.description: Layback and undercling your way past three bolts, then join Unnamed Sources at the top. Be gentle with the choss between 3rd and 4th bolts.
content.protection: 6 bolts. Bring a few cams if you want to protect the runout between 3rd and 4th bolts.
